Package entities.paths

Class DP_Problem_Instance

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.paths.DP_Problem_Instance
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DP_Path_Equijoin_Instance, DP_Path_ThetaJoin_Instance
    public abstract class DP_Problem_Instance
extends Object
    An instance of a DP problem realized as a multi-stage graph of state-nodes where the stages are organized in a path (chain). The edges between those nodes specify the dependencies between them. There is a starting node and a terminal node. The terminal node is not explicitly materialized - we assume that all the nodes of the last stage reach it with no cost. A solution to the DP problem is a path from the source node to the terminal node. This is an abstract class that captures all DP problems. An implementing subclass has to do the following in its constuctor:
    • Instantiate nodes as DP_State_Node objects.
    • Set a single node as starting_node.
    • Set a number of nodes as terminals (those that belong to the last stage) with @link{entities.paths.DP_State_Node#set_to_terminal}.
    • Instantiate weighted edges between them as DP_Decision.
    The bottom_up() method computes the minimum achievable weight per state/node. By default, it works recursively, but can be specified to work iteratively with set_bottom_up_implementation(java.lang.String).
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      String bottom_up_implementation
      Can be "recursive" or "iterative".
      DP_State_Node starting_node
      Single source (there is also a single target but no need to represent it).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DP_Problem_Instance()
      Creates a new problem instance by constructing all states from the last stage to the first stage.

    • Field Detail

      • starting_node

        public DP_State_Node starting_node
        Single source (there is also a single target but no need to represent it).

      • bottom_up_implementation

        public String bottom_up_implementation
        Can be "recursive" or "iterative".

    • Constructor Detail

      • DP_Problem_Instance

        public DP_Problem_Instance()
        Creates a new problem instance by constructing all states from the last stage to the first stage.

    • Method Detail

      • set_bottom_up_implementation

        public void set_bottom_up_implementation​(String impl)
        Chooses how the bottom-up phase will be executed.
        Parameters:
        impl - A String that can be "recursive" or "iterative".

      • bottom_up

        public void bottom_up()
        Goes through all states from the last stage to the first stage, while computing the minimum achievable cost and the best decision per state. After the bottom-up phase, the optimal cost is the minimum achievable cost from starting_node. The solution can be reconstructed by going top-down and following best decisions.

      • bottom_up_rec

        public void bottom_up_rec()
        Recursive implementation of bottom-up phase. More efficient if the depth of the recursion (i.e., the number of stages) is small.

      • compute_opt_cost

        private void compute_opt_cost​(DP_State_Node node)
        Recursively computes the optimal achievable cost starting from some specific node. The computed cost is stored inside the node.
        Parameters:
        node - The node we start from.
        See Also:
        State_Node.opt_cost

      • bottom_up_iter

        public void bottom_up_iter()
        Iterative implementation of bottom-up phase. Makes two passes, one to compute an appropriate order and then another in that order to compute the optimal weights. Not affected by a large number of stages.

      • topological_order

        private List<DP_State_Node> topological_order()
        Produces a topological order of the state space graph. The method works with an iterative DFS traversal.
        Returns:
        A list of the vertices in topological order.

      • bottom_up_compute

        private void bottom_up_compute​(List<DP_State_Node> nodes_topological_order)
        Given a topological order of the nodes s.t. a parent appears only if all of its children have already appeared computes the optimal value for each node.
        Parameters:
        nodes_topological_order - A bottom-up ordering of the state nodes.

      • count_solutions

        public BigInteger count_solutions()
        Computes the total number of DP solutions to the problem instance. These are paths that begin at the starting node and end at some terminal node.
        Returns:
        BigInteger The number of solutions = paths in the state-space graph.

      • compute_no_solutions

        private BigInteger compute_no_solutions​(DP_State_Node node,
                                        Map<DP_State_Node,​BigInteger> counts,
                                        Map<DP_DecisionSet,​BigInteger> counts_dec)
        Recursively computes the total number of solutions starting from some specific node. The computed cost is stored in a map passed in each call as an argument so that we don't have to recompute it.
        Parameters:
        node - The node we start from.
        counts - A map containing the counts for all the nodes that we have called this method on.
        counts_dec - A map containing the counts for all the decision sets that we have called this method on.
        Returns:
        long The total number of DP solutions starting from node.

      • graph_size

        public BigInteger graph_size()
        Computes the total size of the DP state graph as the sum of nodes (states) and edges (decisions) with a DFS traversal.
        Returns:
        BigInteger The size of the DP graph (state space).

      • print_edges

        public void print_edges()
        Prints the entire constructed graph. Useful for debugging.
